original:
The origin of life, referred to as abiogenesis, is a distinct area of research separate from the evolution of life. Scientists such as Alexander Oparin and J.B.S. Haldane proposed that the conditions present on early Earth were favorable for the synthesis of organic compounds from inorganic elements. This process is believed to have contributed to the formation of many essential chemicals common to all known forms of life.

Research in
